page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
The vicar at the time thought it was difficult to fit all the family in around the font because the pews were in the way.The church is built of stone from Kilerton quaries.The organ in the church was from Blundells school.There used to be six bells in the church but now there is only five.
One of the oldest inhabitants of Clyst Hydon is Miss Baker Clark.She lives in the old school house with Mrs Isaac. Miss Baker Clark knows a lot about the church and she used to be one of the bellringers.Her nephew who is ten, rings the bells at Clyst Hydon and at a church in Tiverton.He had a special bit in the paper about him plus a photo of him ringing the bells.Miss Baker Clark has the key to the church and often goes in there.The school house used to be the old school.
